page.title: 01Lundy-the central section.
page.content: Lundy falls into 3 D blocks.For reasons of convenience and space all those things that relate to the ecology of the island are dealt with in the north-as are the children's experiences.Likewise the history and details of tourism are dealt with in the south.The main settlement lies in this section. The island lies 11 miles off the North Devon coast.It is owned by the National Trust and run by the Landmark Trust.It has a small resident population and its main industry is tourism-with some farming.The island has a supply ship and a weekly helicopter service. Although only 3 miles long and about half a mile wide there is a wealth of interest,historical and ecological.The scenery is magnificent and the peace almost total.
